biogHist.abstract:
Helen Vatsikopoulos is an Australian journalist and news presenter for the Special Broadcasting Service (SBS) and the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC).
Vatsikopoulos hosted the Dateline current affairs program on SBS and is currently hosting the Asia Pacific Focus program which screens on the ABC and the Australia Network.
She has a B.A from Adelaide University and a Postgraduate Diploma in Journalism for the then Adelaide College of Arts and Education.
biogHist.p: Helen Vastikopoulos descibes a career highlight as deciding to drive across the northern Indian state of Punjab instead of catching the train. The train she iintended to catch later made internatioal headlines after it was ambushed by Sikh militants who boarded it and shot several passengers.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Vatsikopoulos, Helen', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne
Site Exhibition: The Women's Pages: Australian Women and Journalism since 1850
